title: How to Fix Scratched PS2 Games

steps.title: Take a small amount of toothpaste and lay it on your preferred disc.
steps.content: Take a small amount of toothpaste and lay it on your preferred disc. Make sure your toothpaste is in paste form, not gel form.

steps.title: Apply the paste on the disc in a circular pattern.
steps.content: Apply the paste on the disc in a circular pattern. Remember this as the friction the circular motion creates results in the removal of scratches.

steps.title: After about 10 minutes, wash the disc thoroughly with cold water.
steps.content: After about 10 minutes, wash the disc thoroughly with cold water.

steps.title: Take the banana and apply it on the disc in a circular motion.
steps.content: Take the banana and apply it on the disc in a circular motion.

steps.title: After 4-6 minutes, wash the disc with cold water.
steps.content: After 4-6 minutes, wash the disc with cold water.

steps.title: Apply your deodorant all around the disc.
steps.content: Apply your deodorant all around the disc. Be careful, as too much deodorant can cause damage to the layers of the disc and the PS2 laser won't be able to take all that damage. Some good deodorants to use on the disc are Axe and, if you are very rich, a Louis Philippe or Lamborghini may do good.

steps.title: Immediately rub the disc slowly with a clean, soft cloth.
steps.content: Immediately rub the disc slowly with a clean, soft cloth. Don't rub too hard as it may end up leaving patches on the disc.

steps.title: Depending on what deodorant you are using, the disc may be destroyed, beyond your reach or repaired.
steps.content: Depending on what deodorant you are using, the disc may be destroyed, beyond your reach or repaired. It should be used as only a last resort. And voila! That's how you remove scratches.
